intro: Rafnia thunbergii, commonly known as the Japanese aralia, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is a member of the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces berries that are edible for some bird species. Rafnia thunbergii is valued in horticulture for its ornamental qualities and adaptability to various soil types.
